QNodeEditor.widgets.combo_box module

Custom combo box for selection inputs

class QNodeEditor.widgets.combo_box.ComboBox(name: str, *args, theme: ~typing.Type[~QNodeEditor.themes.theme.Theme] = <class 'QNodeEditor.themes.dark.DarkTheme'>, **kwargs)

Bases: QComboBox

Widget with a combo box that allows selection of predefined options

eventFilter(watched: QObject, event: QEvent) → bool

Detect mouse leaving popup :param watched: watched object (popup) :param event: event :return: bool: whether event should not be handled further

hidePopup() → None

Intercept popup close to emit popup change signal :return: None

popup_changed: pyqtSignal

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

showPopup() → None

Intercept popup open to emit popup change signal :return: None

pyqtSignal(*types, name: str = …, revision: int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.
